author: abcoathup
content:
Potentially controversial EIP numbering, EIP editors can overrule if required:

I assigned **PR6953** as **EIP6953** (the PR number).  <@552133098075193354> had wanted to claim unrelated **6666** but standard practice from EIP1 is it should generally be the PR number.
https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/6953/files/14f0e3bd3d13acf10a38d81c96c5121f189696bf#r1180858685

I manually assigned **PR6969** as **EIP6968**.  Kevin and Zak wanted to claim **6969** but the PR didn't have a specification. **PR6968** is an unrelated renovate PR so using this to assign a number. https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/6969#issuecomment-1530710749
Precedent for manually assigning a number for an apparent number lunge when a draft EIP/ERC isn't ready was for an ERC I authored: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/4888#pullrequestreview-905617398

author: samwilsn
content: I am in full support of these assignments.

author: samwilsn
content: I believe <@267831837240328192> turned on auto-assignments, so we'll see how that shakes out.
